_prev_prog_3.Description: Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. complies with the prevention program level 3 requirements found in the OSHA PSM (29 CFR 1910.119) and EPA RMP 40 CFR Part 68 standards. This program is organized into the following elements : 1) Employees participate in the elements of this safety and release prevention program wherever possible; 2) Training is provided for operators and maintenance personnel; 3) Process Safety Information (PSI) is maintained on ammonia hazards and the refrigeration system; 4) A Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) of the refrigeration system is conducted and is periodically reviewed to ensure adequacy of controls; 5) The Mechanical Integrity program ensures the system continues to operate as designed; 6) Operating and Maintenance procedures provide operators and maintenance staff the information necessary to safely operate and maintain the system; 7) Contractors working on or near the refrigeration system are selected for safety performance, and are briefed on the hazards and safety requirements of the job; 8) Hot Work Permits are required whenever welding, cutting, grinding or other activities are conducted that could generate sparks and start a fire; 9) The Management of Change (MOC) program requires that the impact of changes to the refrigeration system be evaluated and approved prior to the work being conducted; 10) Pre-Startup Safety Reviews (PSSR) are conducted prior to restart of the system after modifications to ensure that impacts of the change are addressed; 11) Incident investigations are conducted for incidents involving ammonia releases and near misses that endanger employees or the public; 12) Compliance Audits are conducted every three years to ensure that the prevention program is meeting its objectives; 13) Emergency Planning and Response ensures that employees and emergency personnel are prepared to respond to an ammonia release in accordance with the plant's emergency plan and that notifications are made to designated points of contact at local, state and federal levels depending on the extent of the release.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
40 CFR 68.155 states that the owner or operator of a regulated source shall provide an executive summary in their Risk Management Plan (RMP) that includes a brief description of the Risk Management Program elements established under the rule.  This Executive Summary is intended to satisfy those requirements.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. is located in Pasco, Washington off Highway 12 in Franklin County.  This facility processes, freezes and stores vegetables and uses anhydrous ammonia in the refrigeration process. The facility employs approximately 280 full time staff and an additional 250 seasonal employees. The facility has residential subdivisions to the west with other surrounding areas used for industrial or agricultural purposes.  



The Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. refrigeration process requires the use of one substance currently listed in the RMP rule.  This substance is anhydrous ammonia.  Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. uses anhydrous ammonia in quantities exceeding the rule applicability threshold limits, therefore requiring the facility to develop a Risk Management Program and submit an associated plan.  Because the regulated substance is also subject to the OSHA Process Safety Management (PSM)standard and not eligible for Program 1, the refrigeration process is a Program 3 process under the RMP rule.   

        

Under the OSHA PSM Regulation, the facility is required to develop a process safety management program, which is near equivalent to the prevention program required by the Risk Management Program rule. Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. developed and implements both programs concurrently in accordance with both the EPA Risk Management and OSHA PSM requirements and OSHA interpretations.  The program for the covered refrigeration process establishes a multi-element program and management policies and procedures which facilitates the prevention of accidental releases and minimizes any potential release.  Simplot Frozen Vegetables,

LLC. staff assigned to work on these processes are trained in the safe handling of all hazardous materials present at the facility, especially those in the covered processes. Each employee receives initial training appropriate to the job when hired. 

The following prevention program elements inherent in the Process Safety Management (PSM) program have been implemented and decrease the likelihood of a release:

(1)    Mechanical Integrity is a preventative maintenance program that includes inspections and tests that assures the structural integrity of process vessels and piping.

(2)    Hot Work Permits are required to prevent fires in areas where ammonia would be present.

(3)    Process Hazard Analyses are performed every 5 years.

(4)    Management of Change procedures are followed to help prevent failure due to improper engineering of modifications, ensure Process Safety Information is used and up to date, and personnel receive additional training, as required.

(5)    Operating, Maintenance and Emergency Procedures are in place and refrigeration technicians are trained on these procedures.

(6)    Incident Investigations are done on any refrigeration releases to find possible changes that can be made to prevent future releases.

(7)    Emergency Response and Planning prepares facility employees to respond to a release of ammonia if such an event were to occur.

(8)    Pre-Startup Safety Reviews are done on all new or modified processes.

(9)    Compliance Audits of the PSM / RMP programs are conducted every three years by independent contractors or corporate representatives.

In addition to these PSM/RMP common program elements Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. is committed to be a responsible community partner through an effective emergency planning and response as required by the RMP rule. Emergency plan actions are based on the most recent Off-Site Consequence Analysis (OCA). The OCA is available for review at the Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. processing facility. All employees are c

urrently trained on the plan and this training is done on a regular, ongoing basis.  Local fire departments and emergency management agencies are provided information about materials that are used at the facility. Simplot Frozen Vegetables, LLC. uses all these elements in its commitment to preventing any accidental release that could negatively impact its employees, the environment or the surrounding areas.
